update.description:
Issue #602 was fixed by 48a5d29 in pull request #1413. I didn't notice this issue in the issue tracker at the time. I'm adding a test here so that we can close the issue. To confirm the failure, the test was added to branch `issue_602_test` off of the 5.0.1 tag and [the test failure confirmed in jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/531/testReport/junit/(root)/REGRESSION_602_unsubscribe_segfault/test_ran/):
~~~
303: [ RUN      ] Issue602Test.Unsubscribe
303: [Msg] Waiting for master.
303: [Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
303: [Msg] Publicized address: 172.23.3.215
303: [Err] [ContactManager.cc:275] Filter with the same name already exists! Aborting
303: 
303: 
 3/32 Test #303: REGRESSION_602_unsubscribe_segfault ................***Exception: SegFault  8.91 sec
~~~
I'll update with jenkins results when they are available.
update.title: Test for #602 (segfault after Unsubscribe)

content.raw: regression/609_unsubscribe_segfault and integration/contact_sensor both pass consistently on my machine.
content.html: regression/609_unsubscribe_segfault and integration/contact_sensor both pass consistently on my machine.

content.raw: It should! The sleep will fix the ones where it only finds one topic instead of 5, and the sort will fix an error I saw on my machine (not sure if it's been in jenkins or not) in which the lists don't compare as equal because the topics are out of order.
content.html: It should! The sleep will fix the ones where it only finds one topic instead of 5, and the sort will fix an error I saw on my machine (not sure if it's been in jenkins or not) in which the lists don't compare as equal because the topics are out of order.

content.raw: Will this fix the seemingly random failures of this test I've seen on Jenkins?
content.html: Will this fix the seemingly random failures of this test I've seen on Jenkins?

content.raw: Ok, I just removed that expectation in c38a8b7386e2 since it's not actually necessary for this issue. This issue is really about preventing seg-faults.
content.html: Ok, I just removed that expectation in c38a8b7386e2 since it's not actually necessary for this issue. This issue is really about preventing seg-faults.

content.raw:
This may be just because of my unique test environment. I'm running this test on my desktop machine through ssh. After your change, I get:


```
#!c++

[ RUN      ] Issue602Test.Unsubscribe
[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 172.23.2.43
[Err] [RenderEngine.cc:682] Can't open display: 
[Wrn] [RenderEngine.cc:92] Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
[Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:144] ServerFixture load in 0.4 seconds, timeout after 600 seconds
[Dbg] [602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:85] Listening to /gazebo/default/physics/contacts
[Dbg] [602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:85] Listening to /gazebo/default/sensor_box/link/box_contact/contacts
[Dbg] [602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:85] Listening to /gazebo/default/sensor_box/link/box_contact
/home/nkoenig/work/gazebo_pr_1450/test/regression/602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:93: Failure
Expected: (g_messageCount) > (steps / 2), actual: 13 vs 25
[Dbg] [602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:85] Listening to /gazebo/default/sensor_box/link/box_contact2/contacts
[Dbg] [602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:85] Listening to /gazebo/default/sensor_box/link/box_contact2
[Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:95] ServerFixture::Unload
[  FAILED  ] Issue602Test.Unsubscribe (1379 ms)
```
content.html:
This may be just because of my unique test environment. I'm running this test on my desktop machine through ssh. After your change, I get:

[ RUN      ] Issue602Test.Unsubscribe
[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 172.23.2.43
[Err] [RenderEngine.cc:682] Can't open display: 
[Wrn] [RenderEngine.cc:92] Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
[Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:144] ServerFixture load in 0.4 seconds, timeout after 600 seconds
[Dbg] [602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:85] Listening to /gazebo/default/physics/contacts
[Dbg] [602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:85] Listening to /gazebo/default/sensor_box/link/box_contact/contacts
[Dbg] [602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:85] Listening to /gazebo/default/sensor_box/link/box_contact
/home/nkoenig/work/gazebo_pr_1450/test/regression/602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:93: Failure
Expected: (g_messageCount) > (steps / 2), actual: 13 vs 25
[Dbg] [602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:85] Listening to /gazebo/default/sensor_box/link/box_contact2/contacts
[Dbg] [602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:85] Listening to /gazebo/default/sensor_box/link/box_contact2
[Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:95] ServerFixture::Unload
[  FAILED  ] Issue602Test.Unsubscribe (1379 ms)

content.raw:
I was able to reproduce the problem reliably by running the test without rendering:
~~~
DISPLAY=fake test/regression/REGRESSION_602_unsubscribe_segfault
~~~
I added a fix in f6439b2 that sleeps for 100 ms before calling getAdvertisedTopics. I also applied the fix to the contact_sensor test.
content.html:
I was able to reproduce the problem reliably by running the test without rendering:

DISPLAY=fake test/regression/REGRESSION_602_unsubscribe_segfault

I added a fix in f6439b2 that sleeps for 100 ms before calling getAdvertisedTopics. I also applied the fix to the contact_sensor test.

content.raw: I tried a [simpler test](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/7c85be0cba20947c4f6b9ec9b5483096a3fcbd98/test/regression/602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc#cl-53) initially, but it didn't fail. I ended up reverting to the multiple contact sensors test because I knew that could reproduce the problem.

content.raw: Sorry, I'll take care of it

I occasionally get the following error:


```
#!c++

/home/nkoenig/work/gazebo_pr_1450/test/regression/602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:78: Failure
Expected: (topics.size()) >= (4u), actual: 1 vs 4

```

/home/nkoenig/work/gazebo_pr_1450/test/regression/602_unsubscribe_segfault.cc:78: Failure
Expected: (topics.size()) >= (4u), actual: 1 vs 4

content.raw: Are the contact sensors necessary here, or can you reproduce it with an arbitrary subscriber?
content.html: Are the contact sensors necessary here, or can you reproduce it with an arbitrary subscriber?
